item.title: Java Generics Bounded Wildcards - CodeTab
item.description: Bounded Wildcards The previous tutorial covered unbounded wildcard, and now we learn to restrict the wildcards with extends (upper bound) or super (lower bound). This tutorial uses following class hierarchy: Extends The <? extends Type> is a wildcard with upper bound. Extends allows us to restrict the unbounded List<?> to some type and its subtypes. For example, we want restrict display method only to Pet and its subclasses, public void display(List<?
